name: Akhil Sheoran
biography: Akhil Sheoran is a professional Indian sport shooter, supported by the Olympic Gold Quest (OGQ) program. He won the bronze medal in the men's 50m rifle 3 positions event at the 2023 ISSF World Championships in Baku, Azerbaijan. This achievement also secured an Olympic quota place for India at the 2024 Paris Olympics. Sheoran is known for his meticulous approach to the sport, taking his time to ensure everything is perfect before taking a shot.
childhood: Akhil Sheoran was born in Baghpat, Uttar Pradesh. Shooting as a sport was popular in his hometown, and he took it up when he was in 8th grade at school. Sheoran's parents encouraged his interest in the sport, seeing it as a way to help him excel in his college applications.
professional_career: Sheoran's professional career in shooting took off when he joined the Indian national team in 2012, while still a student at Hansraj College in Delhi University. He credits the support and facilities provided by his college for helping him balance his academics and training. Sheoran has had an up-and-down career, with inconsistent performances at major championships prior to 2023. However, his bronze medal at the 2023 World Championships, which secured an Olympic quota, is a career-defining achievement. At 28 years old, Sheoran is considered a late bloomer, but his dedication and attention to detail have helped him reach this milestone.
